alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 12:16PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...San Francisco and northern San Mateo counties in northern California. * WHEN...Until 130 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain continuing in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Daly City, San Mateo, South San Francisco, San Bruno, Pacifica, Burlingame, Millbrae, Hillsborough, Brisbane, Colma, Broadmoor, Montara and Moss Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
